executableContent.instructions: Create the start of an html document tree by coding `html`, `head` and `body`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: <!doctype html>
files.solvedContent:
<!doctype html>
<html>
 <head></head>
 <body></body>
</html>

files.content:

<html>
 <head>
  <title></title>
 </head>

 </body>
</html>

executableContent.instructions: This Festival webpage made a mistake. Access the last child of the `main` element to correct the typo. Remember you can access the last child as we do with arrays.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
• Home
  • Artists
  • Schedule
  • Tickets

Welcome to the Music Festival!

Get ready for the ultimate music experience.

Event Schedule

Day Time Artist
Friday 7:00pm - 8:00pm The Soft Rockers
Saturday 6:00pm - 7:00pm Punky Spices
Sunday 9:00pm - 10:00pm Luna Wolf

Book now your ticketo

© 2023 Music Festival. All rights reserved.

executableContent.instructions: Use `document.body.children` to set the text of the first `p` to `35` and the second p to `2`

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Bitcoin Price:

Doge Coin:

files.name: script.js
files.solvedContent:
document.body.children[1].innerHTML = "35";
document.body.children[3].innerHTML = "2";

executableContent.instructions: Create a variable `list` that stores the second child of `body`, `ul`. Use `.innerHTML` to set the text of the `firstElementChild` of `list` to `components`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
What we'll learn:

  • hooks

files.name: script.js
files.content: let list = document.body.children[1];
files.solvedContent:
let list = document.body.children[1];
list.firstElementChild.innerHTML = "components";

executableContent.instructions: Create a variable `first` that stores the first child of `body`, `h3`. Use `first.nextElementSibling.innerHTML` to set the text of  the `div` to `toys, pens`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Included in the bag:

files.name: script.js
files.content: let first = ;
files.solvedContent:
let first = document.body.children[0];
first.nextElementSibling.innerHTML = "toys, pens";
